description: The UI is simple and looks good. However, the program is constantly freezing or crashing wehn trying to load full article or if going through articles in quick succession. This is mainly attributed to WebKit.
summary: Great UI, but WebKit crashes and freezes often

description: I got this app to use feedbin and it works really well for this and looks nice.
Can't login via feedly
The best RSS reader on GNOME!
I was looking for something like this!
Amazing article/reader mode view and in app shortcuts.
I'm not able to log in with Feedly. Otherwise, I do like the app.
custom feeds, folders, excellent UI. Exactly what i was looking for on PureOS!
sorry it is not working for me

But it still needs a whole lot of Polishing but I'am rating five Because I want the team to work Harder as it is one of the first usable news app on ubuntu i can list the Bugs for you :
* It shows two News Flash App Icons on the Applications Menu
* It did not CONNECT to Feedly Channel
* The Add Button on the Discover Feeds is Hard to USE
* Some times it closes while reading News and Adding Feeds

This reader has SO much potential. Very slick. However, I am struggling in that I didn't add any news feeds on start, now I can't get back to the window. Still, I've been looking for something like this and I hope development continues!

Not sure what happened but it took a long time to load my Feedly articles the first time, so I exited and entered the app and it seemed to load quite fast after that.

Otherwise the app is pretty much perfect as far as layout goes.  It seems to be well suited for mobile as well, though I have only re-sized the window in desktop, not on a mobile device.
This is a great RSS feader. Best I have used so far on Linux. Nice work

The "Discover Feeds" included is useful and the auto-generated feeds url for websites is something that can encourage more people to use RSS, e.g. YouTube (only channel url is needed, same as Feedly).

This is the first time native RSS reader under Gnome is fully working for me. 
Previously I tried several apps and got different issues like crashes, usability, slowness and so on, so was forced to revert to web Feedly. This app is stable and fast for me. I like keybindings too.
The only issue I am currently facing is small app window on startup, so I am forced to resize it every time as window size is not preserved. Considering I am rebooting like once a week it not a big deal, but eventually I hope this will be addressed.
summary: The first native RSS reader I did not uninstalled after a try

description:
I was really impressed by this app. But it won't display any sort of images from my blog and other major sites, as if they are not there. But I checked in the RSS code, they are. Sometimes on some blogs it makes missing image icons but mostly not. It will always say "scraping failed". 

This app is so nice, I wish this one thing was working then it would be perfect!
App crashes if I write something in discover
Works well with Feedly
I like this app - I use it for HackerNews, reddit, TechCrunch and all sorts of other sites. It's versatile and easy to use.
It says it couldn't connect to feedly api.

I'm using this app as a client for my freshrss-installation (over the fever-api) and it works better than any other linux client I tried before. There are a few things it's missing (e.g. adding and removing a feed), but overall it's a good application.

NewsFeed is an easy to use and attractive news reader. It flawlessly imported my feeds from a web service, it offers background fetches (off by default) and feed exploring using Feedly (although it doesn't sync with Feedly due to API limitations). You can also add feeds manually. The flatpak app works well on Ubuntu 21.10
summary: Elegant companion to various web news readers

description: Great performance, many synchronizations services, a ton of customization. Reader mode is a huger advantage. You can even set a custom font for it! A lot of key shortcuts make using Newsflash a really good experience
summary: Great performance, many synchronizations services, and more!

description: ...to feedly. Also doesn't seem to fetch any imported feeds from feedly either...
Works well and supports all the features you would expect from an RSS aggregator. It also blends seamlessly with my desktop environment and looks great. Thank you!
summary: Great app. Exactly what I was looking for

description:
Before i used this great app, i wasn't used to rss in anyway but this wasy very easy to setup and works really well but i couldn't do without it now its very valuable to me. 
so thank you for developing a great app. Works wonders for me

I installed it and then wanted to create the categories before I added the feeds so I could then in the menu choose the right category. But well that does not come up any more, so I'm unable to search for the feeds by name, only providing an URL which I don't have. Sadly this is quite poor planning.
summary: Cool if I could have my feeds

description: Scroll on mobile with GTK, pureos is smooth, when adding categories it sokmetimes crashes but ow stable
summary: Awesome so for it works great

description: Best RSS Reader on Linux so far!

Ich habe verschiedene Reader ausprobiert und finde den Vorgänger "FeedReader" als den besten. Alles Wichtige ist da und die Artikeldarstellung ist hervorragend. Diesen benutze ich aktuell, da er auf den TTRSS-Server zugreifen kann. 
NewsFlash macht mir in den Screeshots den gleichen Eindruck. Da ich NewsFlash nicht mit dem TTRSS-Server verbinden kann, gibt es nur 4 Sterne.
summary: Schade, dass Tiny Tiny RSS nicht unterstützt wird

description:
I like this application but that the headlines are cut off after 2 lines are filled makes it hard for me to see the most relevant news at a glance for me.
I also would appreciate a resizable list and a more compact appereance in this regard.
No se porque pero solo marca error de conexion y no muestra la pantalla para logearme a Feedy
La aplicación es muy buena, me permite estar al día con los temas que me interesan
Desde la última actualización, todas las rss locales que había agregado se borraron y ahora no me deja volver a agregarlas, el botón de local rss no funciona...
No la instalo hasta solucionar el problema del doble icono. Ubuntu 21.04
summary: Me ha instalado 2 iconos en Aplicaciones

description: Es muy completa y funciona perfectamente. Estoy muy sorprendido, felicidades a los desarrolladores.

Funciona muy bien. No hay problema hasta el momento.
Versión 1.5.1 (Flatpak) en Fedora 35.
L’application de bureau semble réussie et met un coup de jeune à FeedReader. Petit bémol, on perd certains services comme les flux Nextcloud. Mais nul doute que ça viendra bientôt !

Très beau, belle réécriture de FeedReader. Toujours quelques soucis pour des chemin d'image mal reconstruits mais le design de l'application est parfaite. Le RSS est en perdition, malheureusement, mais cet outil donne un coup de jeune à ce format tellement intéressant.
Je dis bravo !
Je ne peux pas ajouter de flux.
Application impossible as utiliser pour ceux qui voudraient utiliser un flux rss externe ou local, on ne peux rien copier/coller
summary: Ne prends pas en charge le copier/coller

description:
Синхронизировался с feedly.
Статьи закачивает очень хорошо.
Не хватает экспорта в getpocket!
